metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5334 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the gnutls_x509_ext_import_proxy function in GnuTLS before 3.3.26 and 3.5.x before 3.5.8 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via crafted policy language information in an X.509 certificate with a Proxy Certificate Information extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5334` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> looks like this was introduced by https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/commit/2bd323f728d75c44a2d7398503178b75e5b63263

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2').
